pattern_definition: (n, n+4) for n in {6k-1, 6k+1}, k in [1, K]
mechanism: Mutual exclusivity: if p|n and p|(n+4), then p|4, impossible for p>=5
p3_note: For p=3: divisibility of n+4 is residue-class determined, not primality-dependent. If n=6k-1, then n+4≡0 (mod 3) always. If n=6k+1, then n+4≡2 (mod 3) never. The p=3 increment is ~0.
z_score_definition: z = (observed - predicted) / SE, where SE = sqrt(p̂(1-p̂)/n)
z_score_note: Binomial SE is a conservative yardstick, not a faithful null distribution for deterministic enumeration
